name: Percentage of primary color in HEX color
description:
Your goal is to return rounded percentage of primary color (red, green or blue) relative to other primary colors (and to alpha channel) in hex color definition.

So for example:
 - if you have hex `#ff0000` there's 100% of red color, 0% of green color, 0% of blue color
 - if you have hex `#ff00ff` there's 50% red color, 0% green color, 50% blue color
 - if you have hex `#ff00007f` there's a 100% of red color, 0% of green color, 0% of blue color, BUT alpha channel is rounded to 50%, so 50% of each value is red 50%, green 0%, blue 0%

## Input
- #### `color` _(hex string, always starts with `#`)_
  - #### 3-digit hex code
  e.g.: `#f0c`, `#631`, `#ccc`
  - #### 6-digit hex code
  e.g.: `#ff00cc`, `#631c28`, `#cfa901`
  - #### 8-digit hex code
  e.g.: `#ff00cca4`, `#631c28ff`, `#cccccccc`
- #### `primaryColorName` _(`"red"`, `"green"` or `"blue"`)_
  - name of the primary color for which you have to return percentage relative to other colors and to alpha channel
  
## Rules
- only lower case letters will be used in color arg
- `color` will always start with `#`
- hex code after `#` will always have 3, 6 or 8 characters
- alpha channel is only defned in 8-digit hex code
- if alpha channel is not defined, it's 100% (`"ff"`)

## Examples
```
getPrimaryColorPercentage("#f00", "red") // 100
getPrimaryColorPercentage("#f00", "blue") // 0
getPrimaryColorPercentage("#ffffff", "red") // 33
getPrimaryColorPercentage("#ff00007f", "red") // 50
getPrimaryColorPercentage("#ff00ff7f", "blue") // 25
```
